trackinfo.title: Being Antisocial Is Not My Biggest Problem
No Understanding
trackinfo.lyrics:
at first there was an understanding
but there was a need of a lie
so they invented words.
So confusion was born
Statistics, literature, religion
a whole world of furiously fast
typewriting fire to shut down the understanding
to dissolve truth, to destroy balance and knowledge
to every opinion there was a voice
and so much voices, voices, voice
became noise, endless noise, screams.
Fighting, just screams and fighting, no truth,
no understanding, just fighting

trackinfo.title: Burning Cities
trackinfo.lyrics:
And in the end
all these burning cities
all fiery streets, all forgotten steps,
coals that used to be door sills 
and smoking kisses
are all entangled as this one cloud
one smoldering pile of ashes
where everyone can dig and find
what they're looking for.
A memory of something pure
of something better,
a youth once lived
a love or pain once experienced.
It's all the same as long as you find something else
Something more than this bucket of shit
we're standing in right now.
And in the end
Everything is as its supposed to 
Everything is quiet and empty
no word, 
no thought,
no deed,
just 
done.

Junkyard Shaman.title: Kuolleet Etanat
Junkyard Shaman.about: a floating drone-sort of album, with some spoken word stuff in the middle.

trackinfo.title: Kuolleet Etanat
trackinfo.lyrics:
Sade houkuttelee etanat ulos piiloistaan
ne pyörivät kadulla laiskoina ja sekopäisinä
aivan kuin taivaalta sataisi heroiinia suoraan
niiden pieniin suoniin.
Ne tuntuvat tähtäävän saappaiden alle,
ikään kuin pienet itsemurhapommittajat 
hyökkäisivät äkkiä varjoista väkijoukon keskelle
räjäyttämään bussilastillisen turisteja.
Raajoja ja bussin osia lojuu siellä täällä
kuin granaattiomenan kuoria ja siemeniä,
verta on jokapuolella ja aurinko kuivattaa sen katukiveykselle.....

Täällä puolestaan kadut ovat vain märät ja kiiltävät, etanat jatkavat matkaansa ja väistelen niitä parhaani mukaan.
Siitä huolimatta kuulen jatkuvasti niiden rasahtelevan kenkieni pohjiin, yksi kerrallaan.
.     .     .     .    .
Kuolleet etanat saavat minut aina tajumaan
ettei jumalaa ole olemassa.
Kuolleiden etanoiden satunnaiset hajanaiset hautapaikat näyttävät, miten satunnaista elämä ja kuolema on, ei ole olemassa mitään kohtaloa, ei mitään kättä joka ohjaisi meitä kohti jotain tiettyä paikkaa tai hautaa, ei ole mitään muuta kuin tämä hetki, ei ole mitään muuta kuin tämä hetki ja se hetki jolloin kuolemme, jolloin laskemme irti tästä hetkestä ja vaihdamme sen ikuisuuteen, ja se hetki voi olla koska hyvänsä, minä tahansa hetkenä voit olla yksi näistä kuolleista etanoista, pienen kitiinikuoren alle arkkuun hadattuna. Niin se vain menee.

trackinfo.title: God Is Broken
trackinfo.lyrics:
God is broken he can't be fixed
yes, god is broken he can't be fixed
all we have left are all his religions
And this world is better off without them too
without them too

God is a machine that's missing a gear
god is a machine that's missing a gear
And all his children went lost while looking..
and I think they won't find back here before the dark
before the dark

this world is burning it's clear to see
this world is burning it's so clear to me
No amount of water could smother the flames
The only hope that we have now is to wait
that the flames die out.

trackinfo.title: In the Absence of Lies
trackinfo.lyrics:
All the god's die in in infity's hand
his wrists are aching from carrying this land
our mother is tired our wombs are barren
no more sons will come out of this heathen
I raise my hands and reach for the skies
No gods, no heavens, no meanings no hell

and we're all doomed to die
and we're all gonna lie
we're not afraid
we're not afraid..

all the god's squirm under my boot
our father's long dead but so is his slayer
the children are lost drifting in solitude
our light is gone, our light is gone
I raise my fists and celebrate this life
no gods, no heavens, no meanings no hell

and we're all doomed to die..

All God's wither as the truth unfolds
the future is dead and the past is too
the light reclaims all our dirty deeds
All fear will be gone as the darkness recedes
Basking in the absence of lies
I pound with clenched fist and hammer down the sky
no life, no death, no beginning no end

trackinfo.title: Sad Songs
trackinfo.lyrics:
I couldn't stay there
standing still
I had to leave them behind
They had nothing to teach me
Those happy people
Their way didn't seem right
to me

In sorrow is redemption
in sad songs my home
I can't give you a clear answer
of what is wrong
In sorrow is redemption
in sad songs my home

I had to go far away
To understand where I came from
To get some perspective
on my situation
I am in deep gratitude
to the randomness of my existence
It has given me much
and it takes everything back.

In sorrow is redemption
in sad songs my home
From me you'll find no comfort
unless you're like me
In sorrow is redemption..
in sad songs my home
From me you'll find no comfort
unless you're like me
In sorrow is redemption
if you're like me

trackinfo.title: Still Frame
trackinfo.lyrics:
As the summer sun was about to set
We were sitting in the park, at the city hall,
remembering the old days,
that in fact weren't too far in the past.
Now that day is further in the past,
than those "good old days" were back then.
Everything was illuminated by the rusty light
and the pines were bleeding and glowing.
We talked about how precious this moment was
this short-lived still frame in time.
How we were forever stuck there
in that tiny fragment
and how everything was good
just the way it was.
It was still warm, for it had been great day.
It was one of the best evenings in my life
especially because there was nothing special to it.
It was just another evening
with just another sunset
with a friend.

We talked about that evening, how acknowlidging it
made it even more special
and how words
or songs 
could never do it any justice
no matter how we tried.
And now it's in the past
put behind us.
And I sometimes wonder if you still remember that
evening
the way I do
As one of the best evenings
in my life.

trackinfo.title: Insomnia
trackinfo.lyrics:
Sunset was dripping down my jaw, 
trying to sneak out of the world
to leave it in the absent twilight
As if anyone wouldn't notice
I saw a mother breastfeed a grown dog
in the alley
things always turn strange after the sun
turns his watching eye away
And the dogs start to sing
and the lizards howl with their electric tongues
and the gypsies gather around the fountains
trying to sell drugs to kids
and kids trying to buy drugs from anyone
but the gypsies.
Cold chill goes down your spine 
and up your ass
Life goes on after you're gone
You watch these chameleons assume a pose
camouflage, to dissolve into their surroundings
to avoid being noticed.
Massive concrete buildings, element rattraps
all basking in the darkness
gleaming in their own right,
concealing hundreds of pasts
thousands of futures within their walls
after a night of raced heartbeats
they always seem so huge
And you always feel so small
Until the sun comes back
if it comes back
Here
it never comes back.
The shadows in your soul are so deep
no light can penetrate them
or make them go away
You are left breathless
in a ditch of your own thoughts
Lost without landmarks
lost without maps
lost without gods
Your hands are shaking from all the caffeine
and your mind feels like it's wrapped in furs
and soaked in blood.
It doesn't make things any easier.
These dark intentions everyone keeps carrying around
like they were their babies, their only true treasure
You're not alone
We are all here, at the bottom of a sea that's dried out
We're all thirsty
We're all hungry
hungry for answers,
for gods for some spiritual healing
clawing each others eyes
and gnawing each others bones
we're all here
lost without maps
lost without gods.

Junkyard Shaman.title: Comment C'est
Junkyard Shaman.about: I experimented with things. Still in need of a proper MIDI-controller, though. Some of these are somehow loosely inspired by Samuel Beckett's work, I tried to reach the same sort of atmosphere as in some parts of How It Is, and Malone Dies.

Junkyard Shaman.title: Lopun Ajan Kansan Lauluja
Junkyard Shaman.about:
My second cassette album. Experimental and psychedelic, droning pre-apocalyptic songs of the endtime folks.. Instruments played on this record: Acoustic and electric guitars, Ramses drug organ, clothes rack, salt shaker, empty paint drums, Kantele, comfy chairs and paintings (as a kick drums), piano, and probably something I forget. Knives and forks.



It's a sort of a loose theme album about a doomsday cult on a desert, losing their faith and getting filled with doubt and paranoia, but committing a mass suicide nevertheless.

trackinfo.title: Jumala On Kone
trackinfo.lyrics:
Luoja on rakkine rikkinäinen
Luoja on rakkine rikkinäinen
meille jäi vain uskonnot
Ja mä luulen, et tultais toimeen ilmankin...
ilman niitäkin.

Jumala on kone, josta puuttuu ratas
Eikä jumalan ratas tuu koskaan takas
Lapset eksyi sitä etsiessään
Eikä ykskään taida löytää takaisin
Ennen pimeää

Maailma palaa, se yössä loistaa
Maailma palaa, se yössä loistaa
Ja valtameret kiehuu altaissaan
Mut kaikki tää kärsimys loppuu kyl kun aika on,
Kun sen aika on...

trackinfo.title: Harhakuvat
trackinfo.lyrics:
Kaikki nää ikuiset hiljaiset veet
jotka yhä virtaavat hiljalleen
kuljettaa sieluja ikuisuuteen
ja palauttaa maailmaan taas uudelleen
on täyttyneet työstä viikatteen
jättäneet jälkeensä martaan maan
tuoneet rauhan tähän maailmaan

Jos kaikki tää onkin vain unta? 
Mitä tehdä voin?
Jos koko sun tajunta onkin jonkun muun
päiväunta
Et sitä tietää voi...

Maailma pyörähtää  uudelleen
Tanssii omaa rataa läpi avaruuden
On tähtien välissä pelkkää tyhjää
se sama meidän hiukkasten välit täyttää
ja hetkestä toiseen on ikuisuus
niiden välissä syntyy taas maailma uus
jonka synneistä me emme tietää saa
ennen kuin teemme ne taas uudestaan...

Jos kaikki tää onkin vain unta? 
Mitä tehdä voin?
Jos koko sun tajunta onkin jonkun muun
päiväunta
Et sitä tietää voi...

trackinfo.title: Minä Olen Outo Piiri
trackinfo.lyrics:
Olen elämä joka sykertyy itseensä
sikiöasennossa vessan lattialla
Olen likainen neula juna-aseman käytävällä
olen ikuinen looppi joka aukeaa itseensä
Olen tuhannet sirpaleet joista yksi aurinko
tuijottaa tuhantena takaisin.
Olen avoin käsi joka häviää nyrkkiin
Olen palanut lamppu
Olen sulake joka sen käräytti
Olen saalis, olen metsästäjä, olen ase.
Olen elementtitalo ja rotta joka sinne piiloutuu.
Olen ensimmäinen, olen viimeinen.
Olen siittiö ja olen tuhkaa.
Olen ruostunut auto metsässä.
Olen tragedia joka sen sinne ajoi.
Olen unohdettu syyllisyys ja omaisten kärsimys
Olen aurinko, olen ilo, olen suru.
Olen olematon.
Olen vankina maailmassa
joka rusentuu kasaan
Olen vankina tajunnassa
joka rusentuu kasaan
Olen olematon.
Olen elossa, olen kuoleva, olen ruumis
jossa on vielä valot päällä hetken aikaa.
Vankina tajunnassa joka rusentuu kasaan,
joka on vankina maailmassa joka rusentuu kasaan.

trackinfo.title: Lopun Ajan Kansan Laulu
trackinfo.lyrics:
Heidän sormensa päistään lähteneet sähköiset rukoukset
jäivät roikkumaan kuolleina ilmaan. Vastausta ei kuulunut, vain koirat haukkui, vaikka he olivat odottaneet jo kauan. Oliko jumala hyljännyt heidät tällaisella hetkellä, juuri nyt? Juuri maailmanlopun edessä? Lahkon johtaja levitteli käsiään ja toisti pyyntöään rukoushuoneen hiljaiselle katolle. Ilma oli sähköinen, bensa haisi, kaikki tuijottivat kattoa odottaen jumalan kaikkivoipaa kättä, joka koska tahansa nostaisi katon paikaltaan ja tempaisisi heidät kaikki ylös taivaaseen. Väkijoukossa kiersi jo myrkkymalja, josta jokainen vuorollaan joi. Lahkon johtaja näytti äkkiä niin pieneltä, niin hauraalta ja heikolta. Tämäkö oli se suuri ja karsimaattinen johtaja, jonka vuoksi he olivat jättäneet maaallisen elämän taakseen? Tämä oli se ihmeellinen parantaja, se suuri messias, jota he kaikki olivat seuranneet? Kynttilät valaisivat hiljaisuutta, paljastivat rivin toisensa jälkeen aavemaisia, kalpeita kasvoja. Aavemaisiksi ne teki ennen kaikkea se epävarmuus joka niiltä paistoi tämän uuden käänteen edessä. Jumala ei vastannutkaan heille. Jumala ei vastannutkaan heille, jumala ei vastaisikaan heille.. Hiljainen mutina alkoi kiertää väkijoukon seassa. Se ei silti estänyt jokaista vuorollaan juomasta maljasta lisää. Johtaja laski kätensä, kääntyi seurakuntansa puoleen ja alkoi laulaa hiljaa. Hän lauloi heidän virsiään, lopun ajan kansan lauluja, hän lauloi ja seurakunta yhtyi lauluun kunnes se yltyi huudoksi. Koko seurakunta oli nyt saanut myrkkynsä, hetki oli käsillä. Ensimmäiset alkoivat jo luhistua penkeillä. Pian jäljellä oli enää johtaja, joka sytytti verhot tuleen ja mutisi liekkien keskeltä:
"VIELÄ TULEE AIKA, JOLLOIN JUMALAT KUISKIVAT PELOISSAAN JA KAIVATEN IHMISTEN NIMIÄ..."

trackinfo.title: Good Morning World

Good morning dear world

'Cause we're all just drifting lost

and we're drowning in plastic and greed
And we're losers if we don't succeed.
So I hope you slept well tonight
because lose my sleep I just might
If I lose my interest to fight 
for this world.

trackinfo.title: Mudpeople
trackinfo.lyrics:
I raised my hands in a prayer towards the skies
There was no answer, just the same old dull grayness
Endless skies above me, skies that looked exactly like the earth around me. It was all alike, all the same, all exactly the same. No difference whatsoever.
Everywhere I went, everywhere I turned my head
it was all the same, color of the burnt dirt
Color of my father's eyes, the deep gray all over.
I thought this would purify me, I thought this would cleanse me, I thought this would save me.
But I should already know there is no such thing as redemption. We are all cursed, all abandoned, all alike. All burnt dirt. Just waiting to be wiped away.
Do I sound depressing? I apologize, for that is not my intention. My intention is solely to amuse, but as you probably noticed, my sense of humour is kinda bleak. I've seen too many politicians spewing filth upon good people, I've seen too many priests abusing the trust of the innocent, I've seen far too many mothers killing their children to believe in good. I've seen the fathers break their son's legs and tell them to run. I've heard the snap of the bone, seen a limb give up under pressure.
I wipe the spit off my lips. I need to calm down, I know, I know. 
This city is a dead rat, an empty bomb shell,
a forgotten grave on the side of the road.
It's full of dead people who just weren't told they were supposed to die a long time ago. 
They think it all will turn out good in the end. 
But there will be no end. They will never see such thing. There is none.
----
My eyes are filled with doubt
My skull is full of mud
I try to open my dry mouth
but I find it's sewn shut
I hope to find a way
to understand my own position
and to ease this fix by approximation
But I find it's not my decision.
I can't be held responsible
for all the mumble I release
It's always just an attempt to find
a temporary ease
So please, if you do mind anything I say
Just strangle me with piano-wire and
make me go away.
For I am not here to irritate
I am not here to amuse either.
I am here to prove a point and to 
burn alive in front of your eyes.
I am here to burn
I am here to burn
I am here to burn alive
Until I'm nothing but dust.

trackinfo.title: Crushing Insects pt. 3
trackinfo.lyrics:
The mouldy floorboards were covered with cockroaches.
Someone had knocked a half-empty bag of crisps off the counter
and the vermin were enjoying their feast, salt & vinegar
remains of someones breakfast or lunch or whatever.
The flat was cold, the heating had gone off long ago.
At the far end corner, on a rugged mattress there was a 
shivering, tired ruin of a young man crying.
He did not mind the insects, that were crawling on his floor,
he did not mind the cold, he did not mind the fact
his life had had no meaning in a long while,
he did not even mind the fact that he might be about to die.
Actually, that was the only portion of his life
he seemed to wait anxiously.
Death seemed like an first price on the sucking competition
he called his life. It seemed like every single decision,
usually a bad one, was leading towards this final culmination point:
dying in a rented apartment at some suburbia,
with his veins so empty of drugs he could feel the
cold in his bones. Not on his skin, though.
It seemed like his skin would be on fire, stung with thousands of tiny needles,
like all the cockraches would be right there under his skin,
like all the knives in the world would be stored inside his body.
He felt kinda bad, but he could remember one morning worse than this.
Although it seemed distant now, when he was wallowing
in his current ocean of disgust and pain.
It was rare that he could actually remember feeling worse in this sort of state,
but you can understand it feels like the worst hangover ever, when you wake up
without three of your toes and out of money, food or drugs.
Young man turned around on his side, watched the cockroaches devour his crisps,
but didn't know what to think of it. It had been his last money, but it was yesterday.
This was a new day. A new beginning. A new hell. 
He tried to get up, but he couldn't. His body was too weak and the pain was overwhelming.
He made a noise of some sort, it was a long, moany groan, and the cockroaches fleed.
They had learned to avoid his wrath, his leather boots made messy remarks of too slow
insects on the floor. "Note to the rest: Run faster."
He was sure he would die, he would freeze and starve to death. 
But eventually the knives under his skin smoothened their edges, 
sharp pain became blunt pain
and his eyes adjusted to the painful light.
He gathered his strength and rose to his feet, like the first mammal ever to attempt
walking on two feet, out of balance, disoriented.
He took slow, careful steps and crushed the crisps on the floor.
He got out of the door, in to the small corridor, went to the first floor
and out of the door. He went outside, and saw a homeless guy on a dirty street.
There was graffiti on the nearby wall and the wind was restlessly kicking around
yesterday's newspaper. He passed the homeless person who was left staring at his back,
he passed the graffiti, he passed the newspaper, he crossed the street and went to a nearby shop.
He stole a Kitkat and ate it as soon as he got out. 
It tasted better than anything he had ever eaten before.
He looked down at his shoes. They were almost worn out, 
they wouldn't crush insects for long.
He sighed. His life was way too hard to be dealt with right now.
He wanted nothing more than a fix. A justification for his guilt, anything at all.
He felt sick, he felt like he could not live with his self. 
He could not live without a fix and couldn't live if he got one.
He'd probably just overdose and get it over with.
Life, when did you become so intolerable, he thought to himself as he
crawled back into his hell.

trackinfo.title: House of Broken Ankles
trackinfo.lyrics:
I am God's ankle, manifesting myself
through the pain I inflict.
I am a nail sticking out of the floorboard
I am the gun that explodes in your hands
when you need it the most.
I am a parasite who consumes his host.
I am overtly adept to destroy myself
but only use this skill to destroy others
I am free to do whatever I will
And choose to do nothing instead.

I am god's ankle, broken and twisted
Causing pain on every step.
I am tired of playing the part I'm so used to play
Let's all join our hands and dance
Because we did so well
Let's celebrate together now

trackinfo.title: House of Thieves
trackinfo.lyrics:
Thieves wave their bony fingers, swaying their slender arms
in the winds of change, future misfortune and disappointments.
All the hope ills these people, these wretched beings
that hide in the safety of their stone halls.

These thieves have a grin that pierces your defense
and assures you can trust them. And you do, and you open your pockets and you open your houses and you show them the way to your valuables
and you let them steal everything.
This world is full of rotten thieves, just like these.
And they are the ones we chose to lead this world.
And they grin, and they grin and you let them in..
And you let them lead and they reward you by cutting you open.
And you bleed and you bleed until you're just meat.
And it never stops...

Bones of yesterday are hung from the ceiling.
We remember the skin that used to cover them
Wrapped around them so tight it felt like you could
push the finger through.. It's all so easy to say
that you'll be here tomorrow when you can't stay.
Life assumes you take care of yourself, 
because no one else will.
Unless the people around you will.
So you better take care of them too,
or they might not give two shits about you.

It seemed like a some sort of "dead air radio", logic and common sense being turned off and thoughts interrupted by constant stream of visions.

Junkyard Shaman.title: Desert Trip
Junkyard Shaman.about:
I had bought myself a worn out old Ford. It wasn’t an actual beauty, but it sure was cheap. As a matter of fact it was the ugliest one in the shop, which in itself was a sheer horror show. Everything was greasy and dirty and they played some shitty music on the radio, you know, the kind of up-tempo songs with minor chords and some sevenths here and there to make everyone feel even more miserable. The owner seemed to have given up on his employees. That slimy car salesman had promised me it would not get me past thousand miles. I took it. I just wanted to drive to the desert, for once not to think about any consequences of my actions, just DO IT! And I did it. I drove on into the night, down the dirt road as fast as I could. I knew not what awaited me at the end of that road, I did not know, nor did it matter, since it was the road I had chosen to drive until the car would run out of gasoline or I would simply collapse. I had no further intentions whatsoever, just to drive, drive, drive into the break of dawn, into the arms of tomorrow, to drive towards my freedom.



I had walked for hours, but the darkness seemed unbreakable, as though it would have been only thickening around me since the beaten up car ran out of gas. I did not mind, though it was cold, it was silent. Lizards and vultures escaped me as I tried to find my way through the darkness. Moon seemed like a huge bowl of moldy soup in the dark sky, but it helped me see as soon as my eyes got used to it’s dim light. The desert seemed to weave a web of tranquility around my nerves, I hoped this night would never come to an end, I was hoping maybe this could be the night I'd depart from my flesh. Although the thought had always terrified me, I thought there would be no better time. Right here, right now. It would be a life complete. It would be a destiny fulfilled. 



When the stars started to blend into the twilight of a new dawn, I could not believe I was still amongst the living. I kept walking, for there was pretty much nothing else one could do in the desert without any other mean of transportation than one’s own two good feet. I passed a skeleton of a bovine creature of some sort, seeing death "live" sent chills down my spine and brought back the love for this flesh, these mortal eyes that one day would stare blindly into the break of another dawn, not recognizing it, not understanding the sight, not having a concept for understanding, not to mention concept of mere existence, my hopes of losing my life seemed like a distant dream, something that had happened to someone else instead of me. I felt like a snake, shedding my old skin, crawling out of my old self, and I understood, that this would be a brand new dawn, like no other I had seen in my whole life. I kept walking, until I found a gas station along the road. It would be a lie to say I didn’t feel disappointed at myself, when I found my weakened hand opening the door and walking in, telling the tired clerk to call an ambulance.
Junkyard Shaman.credits:
released August 2, 2014
            
            Instruments played: my old 12-string guitar, 6 string Charvel, Banjo string resonator, travel guitar, salt shaker, ukulele, Wurlitzer electric piano, trashed tambourine, lid of a metal box, my voice. It's a soundtrack for a short story.

Herään aamuun jota jaksais en

trackinfo.title: St. James Infirmary Blues
trackinfo.lyrics:
I wen down to the st. James Infirmary
To see my baby there

Let her go, let her go, god bless her
Wherever she may be
She may search this whole wide world over
She'll never find another man like me

When I die, oh please bury me
In my high top stetson hat
Put gold coins over my eyelids
So the boys will know I died standing pat.

Get six gamblers to be my pallbearers
Six chorus girls to sing me a song
Put a Jazzband behind my hearse car
To raise hell as we roll along

Get me thirteen coal black horses
To pull my ashes to dirt
There's thirteen men going to the graveyard
Only twelve of them are coming back.

We had our time and place
But now we're just pushing it
Let's see how far can we go
Just by hating things

Oh, it's a shame that we're like this

Oh it's a shame that we're like this
(Unable to back out)

Straying like the bullets
That did not hit their targets
Solicitors and servants
Eat up their masters
The blazing all-out war
That we call the free market,
Simplified freedom's nothing
But a disaster

Oh, it's a shame that we're like this
(Unable to live in peace)
Oh it's a shame that we're like this
(Unable to back out)

And I hope that I won't

And I know you belong to someone else

And I thought you'd need to know

And I hope that I won't
Do you any harm..

And I thought you'd need to know

And I thought you'd need to know
How sad it makes me feel

Junkyard Shaman.title: Get the F**k Out of My Desert
Junkyard Shaman.artist: Mr. Mule & His Rattling Snake Orchestra
Junkyard Shaman.about: Yeah, I made this album to get these things out of my system, to experiment and to have fun. And sorted the way they are, it's a theme album about a drug dealer who wakes up in his crappy flat, drives everyone out. He sells some junk, drives to the desert, breaks up with his girlfriend and then cries after her. Ain't life fun, boys and girls?

trackinfo.title: Drug Dealer's Blues
trackinfo.lyrics:
I am the devil in flesh, the merchant of paradise
I cut the truth with a lie, to make it worth my while
I know that I am alive, when I'm about to die
I serve my customers needs, and they serve me

Life's like a deal without fix, always on the move
I just escape the guilt with mindtricks, and they all play along
How many lives have I ruined, when sunday finally comes?
Conscience plays tricks on me again, but I smoke dope instead..

oooooooh, it's the drug dealer's blues

trackinfo.title: Skulls Are Full of Blood
trackinfo.lyrics:
Crows will fly, snakes will crawl

Bones will rattle in their holes
Souls will shatter, bodies rot

Skulls are filled with their blood
Merchants preaching Money God
Worms will feed on us all
Even on their greedy god

Pillaging the burning house
Curtains smoking on the ground
Before soon the roof will fall
Greed makes sure, we won't run

Skulls are filled with their blood
Merchants preaching Money God
Worms will feed on us all
Even on their greedy god

Hopeless strife, human life
endless search for ways to die
Monkeys' dancing on a rope
before soon someone falls.

trackinfo.title: Desert Road
trackinfo.lyrics:
I took a wrong turn on the desert road

No matter where I turn it's all the same
Every decision takes me further away

I'm on the outside and from the inside
It might seem I'm doing fine
But on the inside I'm on the outside..

How did I get here

How did I end up here?
And I wonder where I'll be when I die

It's been so long I even can't recall
What was the point that started this all

No matter where I look

I think you know this desert's my home

I smell your fear and it's stench is sweet
I'm gonna hold on to you until you can't breathe

trackinfo.title: It Ain't About The Drugs

Girl, you know it ain't about drugs

And you know that I will gravely miss
Everything you did for me..

Girl, you know it ain't about drugs
'Cos the cheapest ones I got
Are the ones you took with you
And you know that I can't take this monkey
Off of my back
'Cos it's hanging from my spine
And I hope that one day you'll forgive me
All these things I did
And the things that I did not...

And you know that I will carry on like this
And you know that I'll carry on missing you
When you're gone, when you're gone...

Junkyard Shaman.title: Meditations for Piano & Dish Washer
Junkyard Shaman.about: All of this was fully improvised 29th of April, 2013. It's a sort of meditation. The first one is a meditation for washing machine, drill, plastic container and several different knives and a cupboard door, the rest of 'em were played with a piano that was made in 1926. I'm quite a minimalist with pianos, because I think the less you play the more it says, and it guides the spirit in a completely different way. It's like zen buddhist painting, with sounds. And in a way it is, because music and sounds are always attached to some sort of images or visions in my head, I see sounds, and hear colors.

Junkyard Shaman.title: In a Semi-Mental Mood
Junkyard Shaman.about: Psychedelic, mostly acoustic music. I was in a semi-mental mood.. I love reversed shit. Meditational music to be listened at 4 a.m or when you come home after heavy drinking..

            I played all the instruments: Empty bottles, guitars, melodica, voodoo drum, typewriter, typewriter's lid, eating bowl, salt shaker, knives, forks, dryer, bass... The music played me.

trackinfo.title: To The Last Drop of Voodoo
Devil's Got A Brand New Car
Ghost II
trackinfo.lyrics:
When I came back here
I found myself
From this broken bench
and when I woke up
where did I go?
back to the yard of bones

My feet carried me beyond edges of the world
I always held my head high
But all these wars deserted my soul
And left me as a ghost

I walked all the miles
And I have the scars to show
From all the wars I fought
Though most of these wars
Had no battlefields
Outside my head

My feet carried me beyond edges of the world
I always held my head high
But all these wars deserted my soul
And left me as a ghost

When I left my home
What  did I expect
to find from this world of ruins?
And what carried me from mistake to the next?
Honestly, I don't know...

My feet carried me beyond edges of the world

And left me as a ghost

trackinfo.title: House of Eternal Creation
trackinfo.lyrics:
And I believe it was the eighth day when God built the house
To the top of the tree of life
It was merely a shackle put together with loose boards and bad carpentry
I really can't see where Jesus got his skills, since his old man
most certainly didn't have any
And there he settled for his old days,
To the house of eternal creation
He died in his sleep
and his children on the earth
carried on his work
of creating things out of dirt
And these children grew up without their dad
And the first time they saw a picture of their old man
They thought it was a picture of themselves
And then things got real bad, real quick
Dirt became gunpowder, gunpowder became atoms
Atoms came together, had a little wedding down in Hiroshima
and we all know how well that went down, don't we now?
What used to be voodoo
is now replaced with things you do
All the cheap tricks I could do
But would not if I had a chance to choose
Since whatever we ever choose to lose
in the end it'll all be just paying dues,
to reap the crops of this cruel bloom
To prepare ourselves for impending doom
To tear down this house our old man build
And to replace it with our own
For that is the cycle of life
and now we watch it turn another time.

trackinfo.title: House of Bones
trackinfo.lyrics:
These chicken bones flung from my hand
How they swung....
How the land waits for us to be 
like these bones in my hand
Dead and cold, lifeless in the ground
You hear the singing of the crows
When the truth unfolds..

You hear the singing of the crows
out here no one knows
When the time will unfold
when the whole world goes...
..down the drain.

The cats are coming near
white animals with their green eyes
the priests of voodoo...

trackinfo.title: House of Longing
trackinfo.lyrics:
As I lie in here
on the floor with my broken dreams
I can't fight the tears
that leave my soul

And my eyes 
they're so tired of you
All the memories
That I'll take
to my grave

trackinfo.title: House of Frustration
trackinfo.lyrics:
Our roots, growing out of our wooden hearts
From the very essence of mankind
Have started to rot before their time
Like a branch that had no sun
We're waste of effort, a suffocated intention
Lost potential, lost cause.
The bad seed, that grew too far
Tall enough to block the sun
Building home out of nature
COnjuring life from dead objects
Forcing life to mould into a house
And we build a house of frustration
We build walls from the dreams that went lost, long gone
We use insecurity for floors,
And lock our fears into the basement.
They're sitting there in the corner
Terrifying themselves
Broken pieces of ourself
The roof is built from unrealistic excpetations
drifting wood and isolation.
We waste hope on the windows
Thinking it would keep the cold outside
But we all know that's just another lie
In denial of our mortal lives we sacrifice some more time
To feel alive for one last time.
it brings tears to my eyes to actually realize
How much more we could have been
If we didn't waste time in growing beards to our chin
Drinking beers, shouting cheers,
approving all atrocitites the thieves happened to come up with
One-way route, empty canal, a path less traveled lies ahead
But we rather stay inside, enjoy our petty lives
And let the thieves enjoy our hospitality
For another day.

trackinfo.title: The House of Healing
trackinfo.lyrics:
This is the cave I dug in to this element mountain
This is the house I built from my ribcage
This is the house where I perform my spiritual healing
This is the home for those who keep retreating in their lives

This is the house of healing
This is where time will have a stop

This is the life I chose, the life I keep receiving
This are the walls that hold any head's banging
No matter what size you are, this room will make you small
And no matter who you think you are, here you become nothing at all


THis is the house of healing
This is where time must have a stop
This is an island inside your own mind
This is a foster home for your crooked kind.
This is an island inside your own mind...

trackinfo.title: The Reflections Beside Me
trackinfo.lyrics:
Train trembles and moans unsteadily as it plunges into the darkening night. Outside the flourishing, green woods pass by, but as the darkness weaves it's web around the world, I am left to stare at my own reflection in the window. It is like some dirty and scratched mirror, that breaks at every station and shows me another bit of the real world and other people, who watch me watch back at them, tired, uninterested.

Their world is the world of social interaction, polite questions and even more polite, or in some case clever and witty answers. I could play that game too. I know. I just played it for the last six hours, and it wore me off. My thoughts are drifting and slowly sinking, like some recently dead animal on the surface of a small swampy pond. Probably some careless mammal who got too confident and just a bit too far from the shore.

The train plunges into a tunnel like some childish movie-metaphor, and the pressure starts fucking my ears...

Another stop. I am far too bored to watch out of the window anymore. I just sit, let my mind fill these empty seats with people who don't exist. There's the local vet, Mr. Hannigan, sitting next to the butcher, Mr. Flay. They're holding hands at smiling at each other. They won't notice us, no matter how we try to break their eyecontact or shout at them. Right in front of me sits the sweetest old couple imaginable. Mr. and Mrs. Thompson. At nights they like to gag and bound eachother and play all kinds of sadistic games that would make any of us younger passangers flinch. I smile at them and they smile back, simultaneously. Like some old, perverted sex-robots.

I start staring out again... because I'm fucking bored..

trackinfo.title: The Void Beyond Me
trackinfo.lyrics:
And I saw this in my dream
I was climbing up a mountain
I was not alone. There were many people with me
And we came to this huge and flourishing forest
It's roof was of pines and it's floor of moss.
You could barely see the sepian sunlight
sift through the thick branches
But everything was quiet
And everything was beautiful.
But those who were with me were too busy complaining
They could not see the beauty of it all
They could not see beauty at all.
Although they were about to drown in it.
One by one they were left behind.
I kept ascending.
Suddenly I reached the summit.
It was completely flat, and there was a river cleaving it right in the middle.
The sun was shining, there was no wind, no worries.
There was strange sort of symmetry in all this.
But even stranger was what I saw in the river.
There were white monkeys, playing in the river with small white dogs
They were splashing in the water,and the water drops shone in all colors
Imaginable to human mind, like diamonds
It was pure elation, happiness portrayed in a mental landscape.
And I could do nothing but stare, and smile. It was mental acid.
I have never been as happy in my conscious life
as I was in my unconscious life at that moment
watching those white monkeys and those white dogs play.
I left this all behind. Turned back.
Descending back to the woods.
It was almost dark.
I tried to convince other people that they should go on climbing
What was waiting on top of that hill was worth all troubles
But they had already given up. They had decided to give up.
And they never saw what I saw
And no one never will.
It was all a dream.
And now it has ceased to be.
And it exists only in my memory.
And it will tarnish and fade with time.
Until it is completely forgotten. 
Until it is gone.

help me feel again
see through my skin

see through my skin
see the worst of me

I know you're there
Behind my eyes
Waiting for the moment I break

Lurking and waiting

Fear and loathing
Under my skin

further away...

Kuuletko kuinka ne huutaa?

Tulee tuhoamaan niistä jokaisen

Kauemmas kuin nähdä voin

Kauemmas
Kauemmas
Kauemmas

trackinfo.title: Like Fire

And it's all like fire
It burns my soul clean
Through my tongue
And through my fingers
It runs through me

Come inside

trackinfo.title: Son of a Thief

Once there was a man
a worn out car thief

his shoes had grown to his feet
always ready to leave
never able to stay
never able to express himself
out of his mind
the mark  of Kain had labeled him
out of your kind

and the red fills the waters, we see
When you're a son of a thief

Junkyard Shaman.title: Songs for the Old Chestnut Tree
Junkyard Shaman.about: Instrumental music, meditative, transcendenting. Practically three same songs in completely different output. Probably one reason I enjoy making instrumental music so much is the fact I like reading a lot, and it's great to have instrumental music, that carries emotions, colors your thoughts without interfering you consciousness directly. It speaks to your subconscious and surpasses you. You might not remember a thing about the songs, but you end up feeling something, and from my point of view that is one of the main goals of my music. These are mostly inspired by the works of Hermann Hesse.

Junkyard Shaman.title: Vihreät Kalat

Junkyard Shaman.title: Light Infused In Darkness (The Twisting Pyramid)
Junkyard Shaman.about: The end of the world as I see it. Darker counterpart of the Darkness Infused In Light, psychedelic acoustic music. Whereas the first part was The Spiral, this is The Twisting Pyramid, mankind's collective trauma when the world did not end. No need to worry, we all will end someday. If you download it, you'll get the artwork in a PDF.
Junkyard Shaman.credits:
released December 21, 2012
            
            My subconscious did it
